instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2850: What is 820-2850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.D9701: What is D9701? diode in the backlight circuit sitting between the BKL_SW pin of the LED driver and backlight output. Very common for via between this and BKL_FB for feedback to blow, causing no boost. Measure continuity between pin 2 of this diode and feedback pin of LED driver if backlight output is PPBUS_G3H with no boost.
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .
definitions.PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT: What is PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT? PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT is a power rail that powers the LED light in the screen of the device that allows you to see what is on the screen. When this is low or missing, the screen will be dim..
definitions.LCD_BKLT_PWM: What is LCD_BKLT_PWM? LCD_BKLT_PWM sets the brightness of the screen. The system will send a PWM signal to BKL_PWM pin to set brightness. If this is low, backlight voltage will boost higher than PPBUS_G3H input, but not enough to make the screen light properly..

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no back light , not boosting
threads.message:
having a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board got liquid spilled,area around connector and led back light driver circuit.
got no back light.

<SIGNAL>PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL>=12v , means not boosting.

checked:
<DIODE>D9701</DIODE> both pins are 12v
lcdvdd en =3.3v
pwm= 0.3v
<SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL>=3.3v

pin 8 pin22 and pin 23 on <CHIP>U9701</CHIP> all have correct voltage
changed connector and <CHIP>U9701</CHIP> already.
feedback line trace is all good

only thing i can think of is the pwm signal is kind of low?
tried PRAM reset already.

any thoughts?

thanks

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no back light , not boosting
threads.message: Corrosion under PCH probably. Throw it in the ultrasonic cleaner

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no back light , not boosting
threads.message:
"pwm= 0.3v"
Where did you measure?
Always specify the measure point.
If you have 0.3V at both pins of <RESISTOR>R9704</RESISTOR> is not the same as you have 0.3V at pin2 and pin1 close to 3V.
I hope you understand what I mean to tell...
Now tell us which is your case.

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no back light , not boosting
threads.message:
sorry for the confusion. both pins on <RESISTOR>R9704</RESISTOR> are close to 0.3.
checked <RESISTOR>R9704</RESISTOR>, 0 ohm

but i really looked under the microscope around the PCH carefully, really don't see anything, it looks so fine...can't believe anything would leak in there..

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no back light , not boosting
threads.message: and isn't <SIGNAL>LCD_BKLT_PWM</SIGNAL>  comes from <CHIP>U9600</CHIP> the mux?

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no back light , not boosting
threads.message: Fucked MUX probably. Remove <RESISTOR>R9740</RESISTOR> and tie the PWM pin to 3V somewhere.

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no back light , not boosting
threads.message:
it is a fucked MUX. just measure diode mode , on pin 1 <RESISTOR>R9704</RESISTOR>, only get 0.014, way too low, connected to mux directly. 99% is the mux...

don't want to mess with that POS. if I just jump 3v from some pp3v3 s5 rail, the brightness function keys won't work anymore right?

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no back light , not boosting
threads.message: you can mark it as solved, spent an hour replacing the mux. all good now. thanks guys
